page.title: 17SAUGHTON PARK GARDENS
page.content: Saughton Park Gardens can be found at the junction of Gorgie Road and Balgreen Road. In 1652 there was a mansion built there with large private gardens. In 1900 the Edinburgh Corporation bought the house and gardens for the sum of Â£52,900, which was alot of money in those days. Three hundred years after it was built the Corporation burnt the house to the ground as it had dry rot and was threatening to collapse. The stone work was used to make roads but the gardens were tidied up and the Park was made. The majority of people who visit the park live near it, some even as near as Balgreen Road and Stevenson Drive. Some people we spoke to live as far as Penicuik and Livingston but one person lived as far away as Girvan.
